page.title: 12WITHINGTON TRANSPORT.
page.content: There is a twice weekly bus service to Cheltenham which enables people to have a morning shopping.People working outside the village must use private transport although there is a daily bus service from Cheltenham in the evening.There is a petrol station in the village . The railway line through Withington was part of the{Midland South Western {Junction Railway}which was closed in 1961.The track was removed in 1963 and the line ran a distance of 49 miles from Andoversford to Andover. It was well used during the{Second World War for transporting arms and munitions, from the Midlands to the South Coast. There is a disused{2nd.World War airfield on{Chedworth Downs}which was used to train pilots.A runway remains although the area is now farmland.
